Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2009 04:43PM Joyceska wrote: I had surgery on the 23rd of March.  I did not have radiation but I feel the tight bands across my chest.  I was thinking it was from all the staples going across my chest, they come out next Tuesday (Yea).  It is wonderful having the drains out.  I did not expect the tightening since I did not have reconstruction surgery.  I get twinges, sometimes they are very sharp.  At times I have phantom pains and reach to rub it, but of course it is not there.  That is a weird feeling.  The more active I am it seems the more pain I get.  I hope this is normal. Joyce
Posts.Title: Weird feelings in surgery area - normal? Cydney Joyceska

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2009 04:37PM - edited Jan 29, 2009 04:39PM by Joyceska Are there any triple neg doing neoadjavant?  I have done 4 rounds of T&C.  I am now A on my 2nd round.  My tumor has gone from 2.5 to 1.6 with 2 more chemo's to go.  I have no idea if that is good or not.  Should decrease greatly with the next 2 chemo's? Would like to hear what others have experienced with triple neg Joyce
Posts.Title: Anyone done neoadjavant chemo? mommy3abm Joyceska

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2009 08:05PM Joyceska wrote: Thanks for the answer zuffa, it just seem to take so long for it to shrink.  The first 2 treatments didn't show but a trace of getting smaller.  The next 2 took it almost in half?  Now I am on the A of the TAC and the first 2 took it down only .3 cm?  With the side effects I was expecting much more.  I am getting number 3 of 4 treatments of A this week.  Just taking A puts me down for most of 2 weeks.  Taking TC I was up and about 2 of the 3 weeks. It really tires me out.  I am not sure if it is normal or not?   I had 4 treatments of TC and now finished 2 of my 4 treatments of A. Then comes surgery.  I thought they would keep giving me chemo till it disappears.  Now I know only 2 more treatments.  I do hope it is shrinking enough.   Joyce
Posts.Title: Anyone done neoadjavant chemo? mommy3abm Joyceska

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2009 08:50PM Joyceska wrote: Springtime,  My ONC wants the tumor to disappear and it isn't going to do it at this rate.  It has gone from 2.5 (sonogram) or 2.8 (MRI) to 1.6.  I have 2 more treatments and do not think it will shrink much more.  So I guess I am wondering is this enough?  It is so confusing.    I had a nurse tell me what they are looking for is a big change in the size of the tumor to show the chemo is working.  Yours went down about half, same as mine.  Does this mean we are doing good? Joyce
Posts.Title: Anyone done neoadjavant chemo? mommy3abm Joyceska

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2009 03:48PM Joyceska wrote: Zuffa and Springtime, My onc was happy today with the amount of shrinkage.  After for first 2 chemo treatments she almost sent me to surgery because it wasn't working, if it enlarged I would have had surgery.  She waited for the next 2 rounds and then it was working.   I am thinking bilateral mast with saline implants.  I am thinking this is the easiest surgery but really don't know what to expect.  I do not want abdominal surgery that goes with some reconstructions.  Do you have any advise or what I should expect?   Joyce
